feature.name: Always-On Demo Experience â€” A Day in the Life
feature.description: A comprehensive, narrative-driven demo page at /settings/demo that showcases every feature of the always-on AI sales teammate. Follows Sarah Chen, VP Sales at Meridian AI (fictional B2B SaaS), through a 5-act journey: Before 60 â†’ Onboarding â†’ Day 1 â†’ Week 2 (Learning) â†’ Month 1 (Full Autopilot). Uses fully fictional data, no backend dependency. Multi-purpose: internal QA testing, investor demos, prospect walkthroughs.

stories.title: Create fictional data layer â€” Meridian AI company, Sarah Chen rep, deals, contacts, meetings
acceptance: meridianAI.ts â€” company profile matching enrichment schema (name, industry, Series B, 45 employees, tagline, products, competitors, ICP, value props)
sarahChen.ts â€” rep profile with preferences, writing style config, methodology MEDDIC
deals.ts â€” 5 deals at various stages: DataFlow ($95K Negotiation), CloudBase ($72K at-risk), Meridian ($22K Proposal stale), Pinnacle ($45K ghosted), TechVault ($38K Discovery)
contacts.ts â€” 12 contacts across deals with engagement patterns, response times, company history for graph
meetings.ts â€” Day 1 calendar with 4 external + 2 internal meetings, attendee data, transcript excerpts
configQuestions.ts â€” 17 question sequence with trigger events, answers, and timestamps over 30 days
slackMessages.ts â€” Pre-built Block Kit JSON payloads for all 12+ Slack message types in the demo
timeline.ts â€” 30-day progression data: completeness scores, tier transitions, autonomy promotions
competitiveIntel.ts â€” Accumulated data for Intercom (12 encounters, 58% win rate, strengths/weaknesses)
graphData.ts â€” 15 contact nodes with edges, relationship types, strength scores, company history for D3
proposalData.ts â€” ProposalSection[] for DataFlow proposal with 3-tier pricing, brand config

stories.title: Build DemoShell layout â€” act navigation, scene stepper, progress bar, context provider
acceptance: DemoShell.tsx â€” full-width layout with top progress bar showing act/scene position
DemoDataProvider.tsx â€” React context wrapping all fictional data, with scene state management
5-act navigation tabs: Before 60 | Onboarding | Day 1 | Week 2 | Month 1
Scene-level stepper within each act (Next/Previous buttons, keyboard arrow nav)
Each scene card has a small info tooltip explaining which backend system powers it
Framer Motion transitions between scenes (slide + fade)

stories.title: Build SlackMessagePreview component â€” render Block Kit JSON as styled React
acceptance: SlackMessagePreview.tsx â€” renders Slack Block Kit JSON as a styled card that looks like a Slack DM
Supports: section blocks, context blocks, action blocks (buttons), dividers, header blocks, markdown text
Buttons are interactive â€” clicking triggers a callback (for demo interactivity)
Reuse rendering patterns from existing SlackDemo.tsx (1,753 lines) â€” extract shared renderer
Light Slack-like styling: white card, left purple accent border, Slack avatar, timestamp
Responsive â€” works on both desktop and tablet viewport

stories.title: Build Act 1 â€” Before 60 split-view pain state dashboard
acceptance: Act1BeforeSixty.tsx â€” split-screen layout: left 'Before' (visible), right 'After' (greyed/blurred)
Left panel: spreadsheet-style CRM with red overdue badges, 47 unread emails, empty meeting prep, post-it chaos, manager Slack asking for forecast
Right panel: teased but blurred â€” clean pipeline, classified emails, prepped meetings, auto-drafts
Opening toast/caption: 'What if your CRM updated itself, your meetings prepped themselves, and your pipeline told you what to do next?'
Reveal animation triggered later in Act 5 (right panel un-blurs with Framer Motion)

stories.title: Build Act 2 â€” Simulated onboarding wizard (enrichment, AI config, confirm)
acceptance: Act2Onboarding.tsx â€” simulated 5-step flow using Meridian AI data
Step 1: Email entry animation (sarah@meridian-ai.com typed out, corporate domain detected)
Step 2: Enrichment loading (reuse EnrichmentLoadingStep animation with simulated progress)
Step 3: Enrichment result card â€” company discovered with products, competitors, ICP
Step 4: AgentConfigConfirm â€” 14 AI-inferred items with confidence dots (green/yellow/red), inline editing; user can edit deal size to see dot update
Step 5: Completeness card appears showing 42% Tuned tier (violet badge)
Tone callout showing executive assistant voice: 'I've analyzed Meridian AI...'
All steps auto-advance with timing delays (skippable via Next button)

stories.title: Build Act 3 Scene 1-2 â€” Morning Briefing + Pipeline Mathematics
acceptance: Scene 1: Morning Briefing Slack DM â€” today's 4 meetings with deal values, 2 overdue tasks, 3 deals closing this week with delta tags (NEW/VALUE UP/STALE), Signal Watch (DataFlow heating up, CloudBase cooling), AI priority actions

Scene 2: Pipeline Math panel â€” Q1 Week 8 of 13 context, Target Â£120K vs Closed Â£47.2K (39%), Weighted pipeline Â£89.4K, Coverage ratio 2.1x (target 3.0x), gap analysis with specific close-the-gap recommendations
Both rendered as Slack DM + companion in-app Command Centre side panel
Timestamp headers: 7:45 AM, 8:00 AM

stories.title: Build Act 3 Scene 3-4 â€” External Meeting Prep + Post-Meeting Debrief
acceptance: Scene 3 (1:30 PM): Meeting Prep Slack DM â€” DataFlow Inc demo in 30 min, attendees Jake Torres (VP Eng, decision-maker) + Lisa Park (Head CX, champion), deal $95K Proposal stage, talking points, risk signal (competitor Intercom mentioned), meeting URL button
Scene 4 (3:15 PM): Post-Meeting Debrief Slack DM â€” coaching metrics (talk ratio 38%, sentiment 0.82), 3 action items with 'Add as Task' buttons, key quote from Jake about Jira integration
Both with timestamp headers and SlackMessagePreview rendering

stories.title: Build Act 3 Scene 5-6 â€” CRM Auto-Update HITL + Proposal Generation
acceptance: Scene 5 (3:20 PM): CRM Update HITL Slack DM â€” 4 field changes from DataFlow call (Stage: Proposalâ†’Negotiation, Next Step, Close Date, Decision Criteria), confidence badges (high/medium), Approve All/Edit/Reject buttons â€” clicking Approve shows confirmation animation

Scene 6 (3:30 PM): Proposal Generation â€” copilot prompt 'Write a proposal for DataFlow', working stepper showing 6 wizard steps, live ProposalPreview rendering with cover page + sections + 3-tier pricing (Enterprise $150K / Professional $95K / Starter $45K), inline edit demo on pricing, Export PDF/DOCX buttons, Slack buildProposalReviewMessage HITL with Approve & Send/Edit/Share Link buttons

stories.title: Build Act 3 Scene 7 â€” Internal Meeting Prep (1:1 with manager)
acceptance: Scene 7 (3:45 PM): Internal Meeting Prep Slack DM â€” 1:1 with James (Manager) at 4:00 PM

Shows: changes since last 1:1 (DataBridge closed Â£12K, DataFlow progressed, CloudBase at risk), coaching note (talk ratio improved), suggested topics to raise (executive sponsor intro, reference customer request, capacity)
Action buttons: Edit Prep, Send to James as Pre-read, Dismiss
Info tooltip: 'Powered by Internal Meeting Prep â€” detects same-domain meetings and prepares context for 1:1s, pipeline reviews, QBRs, and standups'

stories.title: Build Act 3 Scenes 8-10 â€” Deal Risk + Re-engagement + EOD Synthesis + Overnight
acceptance: Scene 8 (4:45 PM): Deal Risk Alert Slack DM â€” CloudBase Technologies $72K, signals: champion_silent (14 days) + timeline_slip, 4 dimension dots (Engagement/Champion/Momentum/Sentiment), recommendation to contact Maria Chen, View Deal/Snooze/Dismiss buttons
Scene 9 (5:00 PM): Re-engagement â€” Pinnacle deal ghosted 32 days, stall reason analysis, personalized draft email, Send/Edit/Snooze/Dismiss buttons

Scene 10 (6:00 PM): EOD Synthesis Slack DM â€” scorecard (4 meetings, 12 emails, 4 CRM updates, 3 tasks, pipeline +$95K), open items (2 emails need replies), tomorrow preview (3 meetings), overnight plan (prep briefs, monitor CloudBase, draft re-engagement)
Overnight transition: animated timeline showing agent working 11:42PM-7:45AM (Meridian opened email, enriched contacts, pattern analysis, campaign replies, morning briefing ready)

stories.title: Build Act 4 Scene 1 â€” Progressive Learning montage with config questions
acceptance: Act4LearningMontage.tsx â€” shows 6 config questions arriving over Days 2-11, each triggered by a real event
Each question shows: trigger event label, Slack Block Kit DM with answer buttons, answer selection animation
Questions: briefing time (7:30 AM), methodology confirmation (MEDDIC), risk threshold (high only), coaching frequency (weekly), EOD time (5:30 PM), auto-apply CRM (yes â†’ autonomy escalation)
ConfigCompletenessAnimation â€” animated progress bar climbing: 42% â†’ 58% â†’ 71% â†’ 84%, tier badge transitions: Tuned (violet) â†’ Optimised (emerald)
Interactive: user can click answer buttons on each question to see config update

stories.title: Build Act 4 Scene 2 â€” Tone adaptation comparison (3 personality modes)
acceptance: ToneComparisonPanel.tsx â€” 3-column comparison showing same risk alert in 3 voices
Day 1 (Sharp executive assistant): formal, data-driven â€” 'Risk Alert: CloudBase Technologies requires attention. Champion contact has been silent for 14 days.'
Day 7 (Friendly sales coach): warm, encouraging â€” 'Hey Sarah â€” heads up on CloudBase. Maria's gone quiet for 2 weeks. Want me to draft a check-in?'
Day 14 (Invisible operator): minimal, action-first â€” CloudBase risk auto-snoozed, re-engagement draft queued. Notification: 'ðŸ“§ Draft ready: CloudBase re-engagement â†’ Review'
Animated transition between columns as user scrolls or clicks timeline markers

stories.title: Build Act 4 Scene 3-4 â€” Competitive Intelligence + Cross-Deal Patterns
acceptance: Scene 3: Competitive Intelligence card â€” Intercom (12 encounters), win rate 58%, their strength (pricing 9/12 times), winning move (integration depth), best talk track from closed-won, monthly trend (4 deals this month, up from 1 last month)

Scene 4: Cross-Deal Patterns card â€” objection clustering ('3 of 5 Proposal deals raised integration complexity'), stage bottleneck ('40% longer in Proposal than team avg'), win/loss correlation (3+ meetings = 52% close vs 1-2 = 18%, multi-threaded = 61% vs single = 24%), specific next action ('4 single-threaded deals â€” multi-threading is your highest-leverage action')
Both styled as weekly coaching digest sections

stories.title: Build Act 5 Scene 1 â€” Before/After reveal with full transformation table
acceptance: BeforeAfterReveal.tsx â€” the greyed right panel from Act 1 un-blurs with Framer Motion spring animation

7-row comparison table with before/after: CRM updates (manual 20 min â†’ auto 92% accuracy <2 min review), Meeting prep (Google 5 min before â†’ full brief 30 min early), Pipeline visibility (weekly Excel â†’ real-time health scores), Follow-ups (40% forgotten â†’ 100% tracked), Coaching (quarterly ride-along â†’ weekly AI digest), Forecasting (gut feeling â†’ data-backed risk signals), Config (one-time static â†’ 94% completeness, continuously learning)
Final completeness card: 94% Learning tier (amber badge)

stories.title: Build Act 5 Scene 2 â€” D3 force-directed relationship knowledge graph
acceptance: RelationshipGraphVisualization.tsx â€” D3 force-directed network using d3-force (already a dependency)
Center node: Sarah Chen (larger, branded). 15 contact nodes with strength-weighted edges (thicker = stronger)
Color coding: Green = healthy (strength >= 70), Yellow = at risk (40-69), Red = critical/ghost (<40)
Edge labels: relationship type badges (colleague, former_colleague, champion, referral)
Company clusters: contacts grouped by company with subtle background circles and company name labels
Animated pulses on edges with recent interactions (last 7 days)
Hover tooltip: name, title, company, relationship strength bar, last interaction, deal value
Warm intro path: click DataFlow 'Jake Torres' â†’ path lights up Sarah â†’ Lisa Park (former Zendesk colleague) â†’ Jake, with callout explaining the warm intro opportunity
Ghost overlay toggle: 2 nodes turn red with pulsing rings, labels ('No response 14 days'), intervention suggestions slide in
Company history timeline: click any contact â†’ bottom panel shows career path as horizontal timeline with overlapping periods highlighted
Strength scoring breakdown: select any edge â†’ mini panel shows 4 weighted components (interaction 40%, recency 30%, sentiment 20%, deal value 10%)
Day 1 â†’ Month 1 morphing: toggle shows sparse 4-node graph growing to full 15-node network with animation

stories.title: Build Act 5 Scene 3 â€” Heartbeat / Agent Status Dashboard
acceptance: HeartbeatDashboard.tsx â€” always-on agent status widget showing all 9 agent types
Grid of 9 agent cards: CRM Update, Deal Risk, Reengagement, Morning Briefing, EOD Synthesis, Meeting Prep, Email Signals, Coaching Digest, Internal Prep
Each card shows: agent name, green/yellow/red status dot, last run time, next scheduled run, action count this week
Summary stats bar: '142 actions taken this week | 3 pending approval | 0 errors | 99.8% uptime'
Animated heartbeat pulse on each agent dot (staggered timing for visual appeal)
Tooltip on each agent explaining what it does

stories.title: Build Act 5 Scene 4 â€” Weekly Coaching Digest
acceptance: CoachingDigestScene.tsx â€” weekly Slack DM rendered via SlackMessagePreview
Shows: overall coaching score 73 with trend arrow (improving), metrics grid (Talk Ratio 42% target 43%, Question Quality 68%, Objection Handling 71%, Discovery Depth 65%)
SPIN breakdown: 12 situation, 8 problem, 5 implication, 3 need-payoff
Weekly wins: 'DataFlow demo had excellent discovery â€” Jake volunteered budget info unprompted'
Data-backed insights: 'Your deals with 3+ stakeholder contacts close at 2.3x the rate. CloudBase has only 1 contact.'
Team intelligence tip (anonymised org learning): 'Top performers address pricing in Discovery, not Proposal'
Week-over-week comparison: talk ratio improved, objection handling declined slightly

stories.title: Build Act 5 Scene 5 â€” Conversational Slack interface (DM the agent)
acceptance: ConversationalSlackScene.tsx â€” mock Slack DM thread UI showing multi-turn conversation

Message 1: Sarah asks 'What's happening with the Acme deal?' â†’ Agent responds with full context (deal status, risk score, response time anomaly, web visitor signal, suggestion to send case study instead of status update)
Message 2: Sarah says 'Draft that email' â†’ Agent generates contextual follow-up email using her writing style, deal context, case study mention from transcript

Quick showcase: 5-6 additional example queries shown as expandable cards that reveal the agent response when clicked: 'Which deals are most at risk?', 'Am I on track for Q1?', 'What works when people push back on pricing?', 'Show my pipeline coverage', 'Why did we lose the DataBridge deal?', 'Draft a break-up email for CloudBase'
Each query type annotated with which intelligence layers power it (risk scorer, pipeline math, competitive intel, etc.)
Typing animation on agent responses for dramatic effect

stories.title: Build Act 5 Scene 6 â€” Final learning beat + Graduated Autonomy summary
acceptance: FinalLearningBeatScene.tsx â€” the climax: a Slack DM from the AI showing it learned from behaviour, not just explicit config questions

Message: 'Morning, Sarah. Quick one â€” I noticed you always edit my email drafts to be shorter. Should I default to a more concise writing style going forward?' Buttons: 'Yes, shorter is better' / 'Keep as is'

Below: Graduated Autonomy summary card showing progression over 30 days â€” Conservative â†’ Balanced â†’ Autonomous (partial), with specific promotions: 'CRM field updates auto-approved after 47 clean approvals', 'Meeting prep auto-sent after 28 on-time deliveries'
Final stat: '94% configuration completeness â€” Learning tier â€” your AI teammate knows how you sell'
CTA: 'This is 60. Always on. Always learning. Always your teammate.'

stories.title: Build Act 3 parent container + Act 4 parent container + Act 5 parent container
acceptance: Act3DayOne.tsx â€” container for 10 Day 1 scenes with timeline sidebar showing time progression (7:45 AM â†’ 6:00 PM), scene routing, 'time of day' ambient coloring
Act4WeekTwo.tsx â€” container for 4 learning scenes with day counter sidebar (Day 2 â†’ Day 14), completeness bar along bottom
Act5MonthOne.tsx â€” container for 6 showcase scenes with feature category tabs

stories.title: Create DemoExperiencePage route + wire up all acts + final polish
acceptance: DemoExperiencePage.tsx â€” main page component at /settings/demo route
Route added to App.tsx inside settings layout, guarded with InternalRouteGuard
All 5 acts wired: Act1BeforeSixty, Act2Onboarding, Act3DayOne, Act4WeekTwo, Act5MonthOne
Keyboard navigation: arrow keys for scene stepping, number keys 1-5 for act jumping
Settings sidebar link added under appropriate section
Loading state / skeleton for initial data hydration
Responsive: works on 1280px+ viewports (desktop/tablet landscape)
Page title and meta: '60 Demo â€” A Day in the Life of Your AI Sales Teammate'

parallelGroups.reason: No file overlap â€” SlackMessagePreview and Act 1 are independent
Different scenes, no shared components beyond SlackMessagePreview
CRM/Proposal scenes and Internal Meeting Prep are independent
Learning montage and tone comparison share no files
Before/After reveal and Knowledge Graph are independent
Heartbeat dashboard and coaching digest are independent
